aboutMe.description: A short bio about the user.

homeCourtId.description: Reference to Court. (Relationship: User 1:1 Court). The ID of the user's home court.

FeedPost.description: Represents a post in the community feed.

id.description: Unique identifier for the feed post.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N FeedPost). The ID of the user who created the post.

courtId.description: Reference to Court. (Relationship: Court 1:N FeedPost). The ID of the court associated with the post.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the post was created.

city.description: City where the court is located.

address.description: The full address of the court.

status.description: Current status of the court (e.g., 'Runs tonight').

id.description: Unique identifier for the training session.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N TrainingSession). The ID of the user who performed the training.

courtId.description: Reference to Court. (Relationship: Court 1:N TrainingSession). The ID of the court where the training took place.

type.description: Type of training (e.g., Drills, Pickup, Conditioning).

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the training session occurred.

youtubeConsent.description: Indicates if the user consents to their video being used on YouTube.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a message in a chat conversation.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat message.

chatId.description: Reference to Chat. (Relationship: Chat 1:N ChatMessage). The ID of the chat the message belongs to.

fromUserId.description: Reference to User. The ID of the user who sent the message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

Chat.title: Chat
Chat.description: Represents a direct message conversation between users.

memberIds.description: References to Users. The IDs of the users participating in the conversation. (Relationship: User N:N Chat)

lastMessage.description: The last message sent in the conversation.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the last activity in the conversation.

Run.description: Represents a scheduled pickup game or 'run' at a court.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to optimize security, scalability, and debuggability, adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC, and QAPs. User data is stored in a private collection (`/users/{userId}`), ensuring sole access to each user's information. Notifications are a subcollection of users for clear ownership. Feed posts are stored in a global collection (`/feed_posts`) with denormalized `userId` and `courtId` to allow filtering by user or court without requiring `get()` calls in security rules. Courts are stored in a global collection (`/courts`). Runs and Check-ins are stored as subcollections of courts to establish clear ownership and allow efficient querying for court-specific activities. Training sessions are stored as subcollections of users (`/users/{userId}/training_sessions`), establishing clear ownership. Conversations are stored in a global collection (`/chats`) with a `memberIds` array, and chat messages are stored in a subcollection (`/chats/{chatId}/messages`).

**Authorization Independence:** Achieved by denormalizing authorization data. The `memberIds` array in `chats` directly manages access. The `hostUid` on a `run` document clearly defines ownership.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The structure supports secure list operations. Listing runs or check-ins for a specific court is efficient and secure as it only requires querying a specific subcollection path.

**Scalability:** The path-based ownership for user data, training sessions, runs, and check-ins enables efficient querying and scaling, as Firestore can easily shard the data based on user and court IDs.

**Debuggability:** The explicit structure and naming conventions enhance debuggability. Each entity has a clear location, and the relationships between entities are easily traceable.
